name: Hotel Encanto de Las Cruces

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Las Cruces on a Friday evening on the spur of the moment. We drove down without a reservation anywhere. Based upon Trip Advisor reviews, I decided to stop at El Encanto to see if there was availability. The receptionist was incredibly friendly and offered me a weekend rate (which I believe was $89). We were assigned a mountain view room and encouraged to visit the newly renovated pool area.
reviews.title: Wish I Could Find More Hotels Like El Encanto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is indeed outstanding. It's beautifully appointed with comfortable lounge chairs and umbrellas and poolside beverage and food service is offered. One level up from the pool area is an inviting outdoor lounge area with fire pits that are lit each evening.
reviews.title: Great time in Las Cruces

reviews.text: The room was spotless and tastefully decorated. The bed was awesome! My only complaint was the noise we heard from Barley's, a bar/restaurant that is across the street. They feature outdoor entertainment and the band's noise was SO loud. At one point, I thought our window was open. I had to use ear plugs until the band ended their session for the night--around 11:00 or midnight.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: Next time, I'll forego the mountain view and request a room that is as far from Barley's as possible.
reviews.title: Great weekend getaway
Lovely, "Interesting", yet very SATISFIED! :-)
reviews.text: The location is good. It's right off of I-25 and an easy drive to Mesilla or El Paso. I'll definitely return to El Encanto!

I travel a lot for business throughout Arizona and New Mexico. I usually stay at chain hotels such as Holiday in or Comfort Suites and they are usually nice to stay at but hey are chain hotels. I recently stayed at the Hotel Encanto (de Las Cruces) for a business trip and I was very impressed with the location, the staff and the accommodations. The rooms were very nice and very clean. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. The food there was good and there were plenty of good places all around in close proximity. Parking was the only issue I had. I was there for a conference and parking was a little problem during the day.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in Las Cruces, NM

reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Beautiful pool, great price, friendly staff

reviews.text: Friendly staff- from the front desk to the maids, everyone was very friendly
reviews.title: Club Azul the best place in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location- right by the mall, a ton of restaurants, the bank, etc
reviews.title: Chili Festival Retreat

reviews.text: Pool- amazing!!!! Such a beautiful outdoor space
reviews.title: Great stay Hotel Encanto de Las Cruces

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. I stayed in June when they were upgrading exterior and again in August after pool area was complete. Beautiful interior and now beautiful pool area. Took advantage of the restaurant, bar, and spa on site. I travel several states and this is one of the best, most relaxing, comfortable hotels I have stayed in. I took advantage of the offer I received on email and stayed on the bottom floor the last visit and enjoyed my private patio area overlooking the pool and garden area.
reviews.title: Great summer deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has been nicely upgraded. The grounds , pool and rooms are very nice. We have stayed at this hotel for years when it was a Hilton. It is so much better now. The grounds and pool area are especially beautiful. The food at the in house restaurant is good.
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL UPGRADE

reviews.text: I selected this hotel from the reviews on trip advisor because of the location and the amenities. My friend and I (2 ladies) were on a 2 week trip of far West Texas and New Mexico. Hotel Encanto was a nice driving distance from Alpine, Texas. Our next destination was to have been Silver City, NM for some daytime visits with friends. After arriving at this hotel we decided this was the place to be instead of a motel in Silver City. They had room for us so we spent 3 nights here. The hotel is beautifully decorated and new pool area is attractively landscaped. Rooms were spacious and beds were good. The drinks and food were outstanding in the restaurant. When we came back in the evening we didn't have to leave again because everything was there. Our room had a beautiful view of Las Cruces at night. All of the staff were so courteous and helpful. Our 3 day stay was a really nice experience.
reviews.title: Our one night stay turned into a three night stay.

reviews.text: Over 20 reservations for a minimum of 3 days each were made for guests at a local wedding. These guests were from New York, Texas and California and most had never been in this area. The hotel and grounds reflect the multicultural influences of this area in a very tasteful way. The pool area was large, lush and beautifully landscaped. The management went out of their way to provide shuttle service even though their vehicle was not working. Everyone complimented the decor, amenities and particularly the staff; one mentioned several times was George Jepson. I would certainly recommend this site to guests coming to this area.
reviews.title: Great Accommodations

reviews.text: When I reserved the room I was told that even though some rooms still had standard definition TVs that I would be placed in the new rooms with the HD TVs. However when I arrived I was told that I would have to pay $40.00 more per night for those rooms. Huge disappointment!! Also the only room that was available at 2:45pm for checkin was a 2 double beds, although i had reserved a king room and was told by front desk staff that he didnt know at what time that room woulf b available, another disappointment. Additionally, no free breakfast as well. However pool and hot tub were nice but very little shade.
reviews.title: Very nice decorations, but needs upgrades

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was here overnight to see friends in Las Cruces. The new pool looks nice. They could have updated the TV seems lame to have such a small TV in the room.
reviews.title: Fast overnight stay to see friends

reviews.text: Maybe that will be next. Also not sure why they use Eastern King beds. At 6'4" I need the extra length in that a California king offers. Room was clean, A/C worked well.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay.

reviews.text: Clean room, breakfast voucher, very accommodating staff for our company event. Was there five days, four nights and their service and excellent food was consistent through out my stay. Would stay there again!
reviews.title: Cultural Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We pass through Las Cruces pretty regular but decided to stay at Hotel Encanto this time. We heard they had open there new pool so we were curious. And we are so happy we did. The new pool is gorgeous and really exceeded our expectations. The rooms were spacious and clean. The service was great and breakfast in Gardunos was wonderful. Talking to Becky, she informed us about there cultural community partner, John Taylors home in Mesilla we will make additional time to visit his home when in the area. Front Desk will arrange a tour. Hotel Encanto is our place and we will recommend to our friends and family.
reviews.title: We were ready to move right in. Permanently.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was staffed by LANE, who was organized, helpful, and wonderfully service-oriented. We didn't think we'd need a fridge, but he had one there almost faster than we could walk down the hall to our room.
reviews.title: Nice!

description: Our guests at the Hotel Encanto de Las Cruces get to embrace a cultural experience that is unique to the area of Las Cruces, New Mexico. While enjoying the beautiful Mesilla Valley, guests enjoy reflecting on the area’s Spanish and Mexican Colonial history and traditions. The hotel is adorned with original Mexican artwork, textiles and furnishings. Enjoy regionally influenced courses at the hacienda-style cocina called Café Espana and experience unique cocktails at Azul Ultra Lounge: the most cosmopolitan club in the area. Simply put, when you stay with us at Hotel Encanto de Las Cruces, you capture a bit of culture and authenticity that no other hotel can offer. "Hotels supporting cultural causes."
